passage: Recycling is an important way for every individual to help the environment. When we recycle, we reduce waste and give old materials a new purpose. For example, a businessman might recycle paper from his office to benefit the planet. Recycling can also protect nature. It prevents pollution that harms animals and even damages human skin through chemicals in the air or water. Recycling is simple, but it requires effort. Unlike the usual habits of throwing everything away, it encourages people to be active in making a difference. A good recipe for success is to start small—perhaps by recycling cans or bottles—and slowly build better habits. Communities can lock in these habits by providing bins and making it easy for people to recycle. The benefits of recycling go beyond the environment. It can save energy and create jobs, supporting a better lifestyle for everyone. Whether you are a student, a parent, or a worker, recycling is a step toward a healthier and cleaner world.
